SEARCH
Package upei.project

Class Game

java.lang.Object
upei.project.Game
public class Game extends Object
Game class represents the core game logic for simulating a Monopoly-style game. It handles the turns, player actions, winning conditions, and game management.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Game(List<Player> players)
    Constructor to initialize the game with a list of players.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(List<Player> players)
      Constructor to initialize the game with a list of players. It creates a new board and initializes game variables like current player index, turn counter, and winner.
      Parameters:
      players - List of players participating in the game

  • Method Details

    • getWinner

      public Player getWinner()
      Returns the current winner of the game.
      Returns:
      the player who has won the game

    • resetPlayerStates

      public void resetPlayerStates()
      Resets the state of all players (e.g., balances, properties, etc.) at the start of a new simulation.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game and simulates the rounds of play. It runs the game loop where players take turns, land on spaces, and perform actions (buying properties, paying rent, etc.). The game ends when a player reaches a certain balance or after a predefined maximum number of turns.

    • determineWinner

      public void determineWinner()
      Determines the winner at the end of the game by sorting players based on their balance and the number of properties they own. The player with the highest balance (and then the most properties) is declared the winner.
